author: Joanne Kaufman
title: ‘Love and Ruin’ Review: The Writing Wife
text:
Martha Gellhorn, the subject and narrator of Paula McLain’s historical novel “Love and Ruin,” first clapped eyes on her future husband in a Key West bar. She was a smart long-legged blonde who had recently published her first book and was destined to become one of the most celebrated war correspondents of the 20th century.
He was, well, good lord—he was Ernest Hemingway, the author of “The Sun Also Rises,” an outdoorsman, a man’s man, a woman’s man, and, inconveniently, a married man. His wife was Pauline Pfeiffer, with whom...
